title: Changing visas
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Getting a visa Changing visas Page Content ​​ Overview Understanding visa conditions Remain lawful on a bridging visa Expression of Interest Working on a bridging visa Overview If you want to apply for another visa when you are in Australia you should apply before your visa expires. Find out more about staying longer or options if your visa is expiring Understanding visa conditions You can't apply for a new visa in Australia if your visa has a condition that prevents further stay. You can check your conditions in VEVO In some situations, you can ask us to waive the condition Remain lawful on a bridging visa If you apply for a new visa before your current Substantive visa expires we will usually grant you a Bridging visa A (BVA) or alternative bridging visa. In most cases you apply for the bridging visa automatically as part of applying for a visa. Your bridging visa lets you stay in Australia when: your current Substantive visa expires, and we have not made a decision on your new visa application The bridging visa comes into effect when your current Substantive visa expires. You need to comply with the conditions of your current visa until the bridging visa comes into effect. Cancelling your current visa will not bring your bridging visa into effect. This will cancel your bridging visa and you will be in Australia unlawfully. Expression of Interest Some skilled visas require you to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) An EOI is not a visa application and you will not be granted a Bridging visa by submitting an EOI. Your eligibility for a Bridging visa would only be considered once a valid visa application is lodged. If you are in Australia and the visa you hold is about to expire before you are invited and able to apply for a skilled visa, you will need to apply for another visa to remain in Australia. If you do not meet the requirements for the grant of another visa, you will need to depart Australia before your visa expires. Explore your visa options Working on a bridging visa You might be allowed to work in Australia depending on the visa conditions that apply to your Bridging Visa A (BVA). Your grant letter will tell you about these conditions. See if you have work restrictions in VEVO If your BVA does not let you work, or has restrictions on working, you can apply for another BVA that lets you work. To be considered for a BVA that lets you work, you will usually have to demonstrate that you are in financial hardship. We will assess your circumstances in relation to your claim that you need to work. If you do not meet the requirements for work, and you are still eligible for a BVA, we will grant you a new BVA with the same work restriction condition that was on your previous BVA. You can't be granted a new BVA that lets you work if your current BVA prevents or restricts you from working in Australia and either: your current BVA was granted to you because you have applied for judicial review of the decision made on your substantive visa application or you have applied for a protection visa Protection visa applicants who are applying for a bridging visa on the basis of judicial review and who currently hold the condition 8101 are not able to apply for work rights.

# Changing visas

## Overview

Overview

If you want to apply for another visa when you are in Australia you should apply before your visa expires.

If you want to apply for another visa when you are in Australia you should apply before your visa expires.

Find out more aboutstaying longeroroptions if your visa is expiring.

or
options if your visa is expiring

## Understanding visa conditions

Understanding visa conditions

You can't apply for a new visa in Australia if your visa has aconditionthat prevents further stay.

You can't apply for a new visa in Australia if your visa has a
condition
that prevents further stay.

You can check your conditions inVEVO.

VEVO
.

In some situations, you can ask us towaive the condition.

waive the condition

## Remain lawful on a bridging visa

Remain lawful on a bridging visa

If you apply for a new visa before your currentSubstantive visaexpires we will usually grant you aBridging visa A (BVA)or alternative bridging visa.

If you apply for a new visa before your current
Substantive visa
expires we will usually grant you a
Bridging visa A (BVA)
or alternative bridging visa.

In most cases you apply for the bridging visa automatically as part of applying for a visa.

In most cases you apply for the bridging visa automatically as part of applying for a visa.

Your bridging visa lets you stay in Australia when:

Your bridging visa lets you stay in Australia when:
- your currentSubstantive visaexpires, and
your current
Substantive visa
expires, and
- we have not made a decision on your new visa application
we have not made a decision on your new visa application

The bridging visa comes into effect when your currentSubstantive visaexpires. You need to comply with the conditions of your current visa until the bridging visa comes into effect.

Substantive visa
expires. You need to comply with the conditions of your current visa until the bridging visa comes into effect.

Cancelling your current visawill not bring your bridging visa into effect. This will cancel your bridging visa and you will be in Australia unlawfully.

will not bring your bridging visa into effect. This will cancel your bridging visa and you will be in Australia unlawfully.

## Expression of Interest

Expression of Interest

Some skilled visas require you tosubmit an Expression of Interest (EOI).

Some skilled visas require you to
submit an Expression of Interest (EOI)
.

An EOI is not a visa application and you will not be granted a Bridging visa by submitting an EOI. Your eligibility for a Bridging visa would only be considered once a valid visa application is lodged.

An EOI is not a visa application and you will not be granted a Bridging visa by submitting an EOI. Your eligibility for a Bridging visa would only be considered once a valid visa application is lodged.

If you are in Australia and the visa you hold is about to expire before you are invited and able to apply for a skilled visa, you will need to apply for another visa to remain in Australia.

If you are in Australia and the visa you hold is about to expire before you are invited and able to apply for a skilled visa, you will need to apply for another visa to remain in Australia.

If you do not meet the requirements for the grant of another visa, you will need to depart Australia before your visa expires.Explore your visa options.

If you do not meet the requirements for the grant of another visa, you will need to depart Australia before your visa expires.
Explore your visa options
.

## Working on a bridging visa

Working on a bridging visa

You might be allowed to work in Australia depending on the visa conditions that apply to your Bridging Visa A (BVA). Your grant letter will tell you about these conditions. See if you have work restrictions inVEVO.

You might be allowed to work in Australia depending on the visa conditions that apply to your Bridging Visa A (BVA). Your grant letter will tell you about these conditions. See if you have work restrictions in
VEVO
.

If your BVA does not let you work, or has restrictions on working, you can apply for another BVA that lets you work. To be considered for a BVA that lets you work, you will usually have to demonstrate that you are in financial hardship.

If your BVA does not let you work, or has restrictions on working, you can apply for another BVA that lets you work. To be considered for a BVA that lets you work, you will usually have to demonstrate that you are in financial hardship.

We will assess your circumstances in relation to your claim that you need to work. If you do not meet the requirements for work, and you are still eligible for a BVA, we will grant you a new BVA with the same work restriction condition that was on your previous BVA.

We will assess your circumstances in relation to your claim that you need to work. If you do not meet the requirements for work, and you are still eligible for a BVA, we will grant you a new BVA with the same work restriction condition that was on your previous BVA.

You can't be granted a new BVA that lets you work if your current BVA prevents or restricts you from working in Australia and either:

You can't be granted a new BVA that lets you work if your current BVA prevents or restricts you from working in Australia and either:
- your current BVA was granted to you because you have applied for judicial review of the decision made on your substantive visa application or
your current BVA was granted to you because you have applied for judicial review of the decision made on your substantive visa application or
- you have applied for a protection visa
you have applied for a protection visa

Protection visa applicants who are applying for a bridging visa on the basis of judicial review and who currently hold the condition 8101 are not able to apply for work rights.

Protection visa applicants who are applying for a bridging visa on the basis of judicial review and who currently hold the condition 8101 are not able to apply for work rights.
